author: wsjcom
title: What’s News: Business & Finance
text:
0 COMMENTS Walmart is in preliminary talks to buy insurer Humana, a deal that would mark a dramatic shift for the retailer and the latest in a recent flurry of major mergers in health-care services.
Trump lashed out at Amazon over its business practices and economic impact, escalating his long-running feud with the company. .
Microsoft is downgrading the role of Windows as it reorganizes around its cloud-computing operations and Office productivity business.
Major U.S. stock indexes posted gains. The Dow added 254.69 points to 24103.11 but was down 2.5% for the quarter.
Tesla is recalling about 123,000 Model S sedans after discovering that corrosion of certain bolts could lead to a power-steering failure.
Vanguard is facing a perception problem as customers say its size and record inflows are causing service issues.
Consumer spending in the U.S. rose at a muted pace in February for the second month in a row.
Barclays agreed to pay $2 billion in civil penalties to resolve Justice Department claims of fraud in the sale of mortgage securities.
A law firm hired by the family of a woman who died after being struck by a self-driving Uber vehicle said the issue “has been resolved.”
A judge ruled that coffee in California must carry a cancer warning, a blow to Starbucks and other retailers.
